projectInfo.name: gt2
projectInfo.credits: This report contains data retrieved from the National Vulnerability Database: http://nvd.nist.gov

dependency.description: Abstract datastore implementation and helper classes / apis to be extended by datastores backed by releational databases accesible via jdbc.

evidence.name: description

ArcSDE DataStore plugin.

vulnerability.name: CVE-2005-2992
vulnerability.description: arc 5.21j and earlier allows local users to overwrite arbitrary files via a symlink attack on temporary files, a different type of vulnerability than CVE-2005-2945.

reference.name: 20050920 Re: arc insecure temporary file creation

vulnerability.name: CVE-2005-2945
vulnerability.description: arc 5.21j and earlier create temporary files with world-readable permissions, which allows local users to read sensitive information from files created by (1) arc (arc.c) or (2) marc (marc.c).

dependency.description: DataStore for Oracle Database.
DataAccess to create FeatureTypes defined in application schema.

evidence.name: description
evidence.value: DataAccess to create FeatureTypes defined in application schema.

dependency.description: The MySQL module contains an implementation of the DataStore interface (found in data), as well as the older DataSource interface (found in core), for use with MySQL.

evidence.name: description
evidence.value: The MySQL module contains an implementation of the DataStore interface (found in data), as well as the older DataSource interface (found in core), for use with MySQL.

vulnerability.name: CVE-2012-5627
vulnerability.description: Oracle MySQL and MariaDB 5.5.x before 5.5.29, 5.3.x before 5.3.12, and 5.2.x before 5.2.14 does not modify the salt during multiple executions of the change_user command within the same connection which makes it easier for remote authenticated users to conduct brute force password guessing attacks.

reference.name: 20121203 MySQL Local/Remote FAST Account Password Cracking
20121205 Re: MySQL Local/Remote FAST Account Password Cracking
[oss-security] 20121206 Re: CVE request: Mysql/Mariadb insecure salt-usage

vulnerability.name: CVE-2008-4098
vulnerability.cwe: CWE-59 Improper Link Resolution Before File Access ('Link Following')
vulnerability.description: MySQL before 5.0.67 allows local users to bypass certain privilege checks by calling CREATE TABLE on a MyISAM table with modified (1) DATA DIRECTORY or (2) INDEX DIRECTORY arguments that are originally associated with pathnames without symlinks, and that can point to tables created at a future time at which a pathname is modified to contain a symlink to a subdirectory of the MySQL home data directory. NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2008-4097.

reference.name: [oss-security] 20080909 Re: CVE request: MySQL incomplete fix for CVE-2008-2079
[oss-security] 20080916 Re: CVE request: MySQL incomplete fix for CVE-2008-2079

vulnerability.name: CVE-2008-0226
vulnerability.cwe: CWE-119 Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer
vulnerability.description: Multiple buffer overflows in yaSSL 1.7.5 and earlier, as used in MySQL and possibly other products, allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via (1) the ProcessOldClientHello function in handshake.cpp or (2) "input_buffer& operator>>" in yassl_imp.cpp.

reference.name: 20080104 Pre-auth buffer-overflow in mySQL through yaSSL

evidence.name: name
evidence.value: Dynamic symbolizer module based on JFreeChart and Eastwood

dependency.description: Extension of the of Grid Coverage plugins, to read matlab files with georefencing information.

dependency.description: Provides a standard interface to the DB2 Spatial Extender. More information can be found at: http://www.software.ibm.com/data/spatial.

evidence.name: description
evidence.value: Provides a standard interface to the DB2 Spatial Extender. More information can be found at: http://www.software.ibm.com/data/spatial.

vulnerability.name: CVE-2012-3324
vulnerability.cwe: CWE-22 Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal')
vulnerability.description: Directory traversal vulnerability in the UTL_FILE module in IBM DB2 and DB2 Connect 10.1 before FP1 on Windows allows remote authenticated users to modify, delete, or read arbitrary files via a pathname in the file field.

vulnerability.name: CVE-2007-5090
vulnerability.cwe: CWE-264 Permissions, Privileges, and Access Controls
vulnerability.description: Unspecified vulnerability in IBM Rational ClearQuest (CQ), when a Microsoft SQL Server or an IBM DB2 database is used, allows attackers to corrupt data via unspecified vectors.

dependency.description: GML3 XML support for Geotools.
DataStore for SQL Server Database.

Graph classes that builds and walk networks based on Feature relationships. The original graph package has been developed using the JUMP Feature API. Its intension is to be able to aid automated skeletonization of water bodies by computing directionality of generated skeletons. The work for the original JUMP based library has been funded by the BC Proventional Government department of BMGS. This library has been ported to geotools2 as part of the VWFS project sponcered by Geo Innovations.

evidence.name: description
evidence.value: Graph classes that builds and walk networks based on Feature relationships. The original graph package has been developed using the JUMP Feature API. Its intension is to be able to aid automated skeletonization of water bodies by computing directionality of generated skeletons. The work for the original JUMP based library has been funded by the BC Proventional Government department of BMGS. This library has been ported to geotools2 as part of the VWFS project sponcered by Geo Innovations.

evidence.value: This is a basic 2D ISO 19107 implementation which uses JTS for the computational geometry.

dependency.description: Filter XML support for Geotools.
DataStore for PostGIS Database.
Connection to an EPSG postgreSQL database. This database should be built by the user from the SQL scripts delivered by EPSG.
dependency.license: Lesser General Public License (LGPL): http://svn.osgeo.org/geotools/trunk/modules/plugin/epsg-postgresql/LICENSE.html BSD License for PostgreSQL JDBC driver: http://svn.osgeo.org/geotools/trunk/licenses/PostgreSQL.html

evidence.name: description
evidence.value: Connection to an EPSG postgreSQL database. This database should be built by the user from the SQL scripts delivered by EPSG.

evidence.name: name
evidence.value: EPSG Authority Service using PostgreSQL database

vulnerability.name: CVE-2010-0733
vulnerability.description: Integer overflow in src/backend/executor/nodeHash.c in PostgreSQL 8.4.1 and earlier, and 8.5 through 8.5alpha2, allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (daemon crash) via a SELECT statement with many LEFT JOIN clauses, related to certain hashtable size calculations.

reference.name: [oss-security] 20100309 CVE Request: postgresql integer overflow in hash table size calculation
[oss-security] 20100316 Re: CVE Request: postgresql integer overflow in hash table size calculation
[pgsql-bugs] 20091028 BUG #5145: Complex query with lots of LEFT JOIN causes segfault
[pgsql-bugs] 20091029 Re: BUG #5145: Complex query with lots of LEFT JOIN causes segfault
[pgsql-bugs] 20091029 Re: BUG #5145: Complex query with lots of LEFT JOIN causes segfault
[pgsql-bugs] 20091030 Re: BUG #5145: Complex query with lots of LEFT JOIN causes segfault

vulnerability.name: CVE-2007-4772
vulnerability.description: The regular expression parser in TCL before 8.4.17, as used in PostgreSQL 8.2 before 8.2.6, 8.1 before 8.1.11, 8.0 before 8.0.15, and 7.4 before 7.4.19, allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (infinite loop) via a crafted regular expression.

reference.name: 20080604 VMSA-2008-0009 Updates to VMware Workstation, VMware Player, VMware ACE, VMware Fusion, VMware Server, VMware VIX API, VMware ESX, VMware ESXi resolve critical security issues

vulnerability.name: CVE-2007-2138
vulnerability.description: Untrusted search path vulnerability in PostgreSQL before 7.3.19, 7.4.x before 7.4.17, 8.0.x before 8.0.13, 8.1.x before 8.1.9, and 8.2.x before 8.2.4 allows remote authenticated users, when permitted to call a SECURITY DEFINER function, to gain the privileges of the function owner, related to "search_path settings."

dependency.description: TODO

Contains extra CRS defined by ESRI (and other parties) in the EPSG namespace. Those CRS are not defined in the official ESPG database, but are used widely enough to warant an optional plugin in Geotools. This plugin do not contains any definition already found in the official EPSG database - it is not a replacement for epsg-hsql or epsg-postgresql. One of the above plugins (at user choice) should be in the classpath.

evidence.name: description
evidence.value: Contains extra CRS defined by ESRI (and other parties) in the EPSG namespace. Those CRS are not defined in the official ESPG database, but are used widely enough to warant an optional plugin in Geotools. This plugin do not contains any definition already found in the official EPSG database - it is not a replacement for epsg-hsql or epsg-postgresql. One of the above plugins (at user choice) should be in the classpath.

dependency.description:
The api module contains the GeoTools public interfaces that are used by other GeoTools modules (and GeoTools applications). Where possible we make use of standard interfaces from projects such as GeoAPI and JTS.
The formal GeoTools public api consists of this module, geoapi and jts. If you find yourself using implementations specific classes (such as new ShapefileDataStore(...) chances are you are doing it wrong.

evidence.name: description
evidence.value: The api module contains the GeoTools public interfaces that are used by other GeoTools modules (and GeoTools applications). Where possible we make use of standard interfaces from projects ...

dependency.description:
EPSG and AUTO authority factories are defined for data.crs.CRSService. These codes are used to provide CoordinateRegerenceSystem for GCE and DataStore implementations that do not define their own native definition.
Contains a Property file based CoordinateSystemAuthority (the property file is too large to be included in the main geotools release). This class will need to be ported to the new GeoAPI CoordinateReferenceSystem interfaces.

evidence.name: description
evidence.value:
EPSG and AUTO authority factories are defined for data.crs.CRSService. These codes are used to provide CoordinateRegerenceSystem for GCE and DataStore implementations that do not define their own native definition.
Contains a Property file based CoordinateSystemAuthority (the property file is too large to be included in the main geotools release). This class will need to be ported to the new GeoAPI CoordinateReferenceSystem interfaces.

dependency.description: Transforms coordinates from "heights above the ellipsoid" to "heights above the geoid". Installing the JAR on the classpath should be suffisient for making vertical transformations available to an application like any other transforms.

dependency.description: (todo)

An OGC Web Map Server client implementation that can be used directly or as through the GridCoverageExchange API. Direct usage is recommended, as the GridCoverageExchange access for WMS is not well tested and is complicated to use. It supports WMS versions 1.0.0, 1.1.0, 1.1.1, and 1.3.0.

evidence.name: description
evidence.value: An OGC Web Map Server client implementation that can be used directly or as through the GridCoverageExchange API. Direct usage is recommended, as the GridCoverageExchange access for WMS is not well tested and is complicated to use. It supports WMS versions 1.0.0, 1.1.0, 1.1.1, and 1.3.0.
